question: What exactly does one RED session include?
answer: The RED session is a 1-hour long class where we practice a specific sequence of yoga stretches and postures, movements, breathing techniques, cleansing techniques, hormone-balancing practices, and de-stressing techniques for a complete yoga workout. This works to improve your metabolism, burn fat, improve muscle strength and tone, and help all your bodily functions to regain their optimum functionality, resulting in sustainable weight-loss, a sculpted body, amazing fitness levels and a calm, happy mind

question: How is a RED session different from a normal fitness workout?
answer: The RED session not only burns calories and tones your muscles; it does all this by using yoga postures and powerful yogic techniques that are also designed to boost your energy levels, optimize your breathing and de-stress your mind. By focusing on overall well-being, you will notice changes not only in your body but also in your lifestyle because lifestyle is simply a reflection of your mental state.

question: Do I need to do any other physical fitness routine along with this?
answer: The RED program is complete on its own - no other physical fitness routine is needed if they are practiced regularly. In fact, the RED program will give you a huge boost of energy that will allow you to enjoy and perform other physical and sport activities even more!

question: Is the RED Program for a specific duration?
answer: You can start the RED program anytime. The classes are on-going, without any time limit.

question: How often should I do RED?
answer: We recommend that you do all 5 sessions a week, leaving a 2-day rest period for full recovery and rest.

question: What equipment is required to do a class?
answer: All the practices are free-floor and do not involve the use of weights or other props. All one needs is a yoga mat, comfortable clothes and a hand towel.

question: What are the pre-requisites to join RED?
answer: There are no pre-requisites. Just a willing mind and a committed spirit!

question: I am 65 years old. Will I be able to keep up with the program?
answer: Everyone can benefit with the RED program. Our classes are taught for varying levels of difficulty and strength. If you want to become stronger and fitter, are moderately over-weight to obese, or suffer from life-style conditions like diabetes, asthma, high-blood pressure, hormone-related diseases, insomnia, digestive disorders and mental or emotional disturbance, then this program is definitely for you.

question: If I have physical limitations / chronic injuries / health issues can I still do the RED Class?
answer: For any medical issues/injuries please consult your doctor and one of our trainers before starting RED.

question: How long must I do the Program?
answer: Results will be evident after few weeks of practice. But to see a significant change, 3-6 months of regular practice is optimum. One can do RED long-term too, in order to sustain achieved results, as part of the daily physical fitness routine.

question: Do I need to follow a diet or take some extra pills?
answer: Pills definitely not! But if your food eating habits are balanced and healthy, you are sure to see better results. Included in the RED program are some simple and easy to follow guidelines for healthy eating and lifestyle. Do practice these for optimum results.

question: How much weight can I expect to lose?
answer: Typically, people lose around 1-4 kg a month. However, this may vary, depending on factors such as age, gender, lifestyle, hereditary factors, medical issues, hormonal issues, diet, etc.

question: How many Calories can I expect to burn in one RED session?
answer: On an average about 300-400 calories are burnt in a typical RED class. This may differ from person to person, depending on one’s abilities and effort made.

question: Can a beginner join this Program?
answer: Yes. Absolutely anyone can join the RED program without any prior knowledge or practice of yoga. The program is designed for everyone and our trainers are specifically trained to work with each student, providing easier options for every type of exercise or posture.

question: What if I am not flexible? Can I still do the RED program?
answer: Absolutely. The idea of starting yoga is to slowly increase flexibility and improve your range of movement. Within a week or two your body will quickly adapt to the postures and exercises. And you would be losing weight at the same time as well!

question: Will I gain weight once I stop the classes?
answer: Any physical fitness routine if stopped and followed by a sedentary lifestyle with an improper diet can lead to weight-gain. However, the impact of Yoga lasts longer compared to any other physical fitness routine, since it positively affects all the internal systems of the body. Moreover, we believe that once you start feeling better in your body and mind, there is simply no looking back!
